intro: Astronia pacifica, commonly known as the Pacific astronia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Hawaii. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline, adapting to the harsh coastal environment. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing a dense canopy that helps stabilize dunes. Astronia pacifica plays an important role in the local ecosystem by supporting pollinators and preventing soil erosion.
